poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Booze is essential Sounds like a plural Just seeing double Like four boobs for two Two boors for one Fat Boab and the Broons Play bools on the green baize Blues on the red blaise. The stupit Balloons. The readership boos And turns to the crossword A rustle of canvas As booms come about The boons of saturation sale Blooms in iron ingot Get you bigger banner heads I GOT THE BROOS or TROUBLE BREWS - my heid, for it Secretes a bruise Where rhythm roots. And broods.
Ach but browns and blues are fine in fabric, Bounds of gold, say, arabesque, or bowers of Pleached boughs on canvas; the brows of brothers As their freshest consort Bows.
